snippet: Only once since 1950 has the American stock market fallen in the last 11 months of a year when it rose 4 percent or more in January.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says that the strong stock market in January could be a sign of a good year to come; points out that only once since 1950 did the market fall in the last 11 months of a year when it rose 4 percent or more in January.
lead_paragraph: Only once since 1950 has the American stock market fallen in the last 11 months of a year when it rose 4 percent or more in January.

headline.print_headline: For Markets, a Strong January Is a Good Sign
headline.seo: For Markets, a Strong January Is a Good Sign
headline.main: For Markets, a Strong January Is a Good Sign
